newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA LEV DIPS, TRADE NIL ON EXPECTED RATE RISE.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA LEV DIPS, TRADE NIL ON EXPECTED RATE RISE.

text.p: 0700 GMT - The lev was quoted between 1,571-1,575 per
dollar, softer from 1,569-1,571 at Wednesday's close partly due
to the longer value date of spot deals but no trades were seen
as the interbank market evaluated the chances of a rise in the
* Rising yields at T-bill auctions this week could signal a
rise in the central bank main interest rate, now set at 43.08
* The central bank said last week it would adjust the rate
to the weighted average effective annual yield of four-week
discount T-bills auctioned daily from Friday through Thursday.
* The average yield to maturity on four-week paper
auctioned on Wednesday was 3.80 percent, up from 3.78 percent
at Tuesday's auction, 3.76 percent on Monday and 3.77 percent
* Central bank officials were unavailable to comment.
